That is some expensive boards, but I'm not really sure.  Hell it might be a deal.  WHat would I know.  I know how to turn on the box and start receving messages, but I'm at the learning stage.  I reading a book on basic electronics. 
   
  later
  
William Rees Clarke  

purplespacefriend <purplealiengirl@...> wrote:
          That's what I'm planning on next week, their mini boards, 3 for $60. 
I've tried to make boards myself, but it's just one word c-r-a-p-p-y!

Frank-S

--- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com, Zack Widup <w9sz@...> wrote:
>
> 
> Hi Frank,
> 
> I think you mentioned once before you were thinking about using 
PCBExpress 
> to make boards. I could probably make them a lot cheaper than they 
do. 
> The only drawback I have is that if they are double-sided boards, I 
can't 
> do plated-through holes and have to use "C" wires for thru-board 
> connections.
> 
> Zack
> 
> On Tue, 8 Apr 2008, Frank Sumption wrote:
> 
> >
> >
> > I hate to ask for anything. I can afford what I need for myself. 
What I want to do is make some printed circuit boards that have the 
sweep, and amplifiers, then I would only have to add whatever tuner I 
want to use to form a system, and I could make the boards available. 
I wouldn't mind putting this stuff together for others, but the 
requests/demands are so overwhelming, there just isn't enough time.
> >
> > Frank-S
>
